definitions.definition: To move:
(chiefly of a machine) To work or function (properly); to move or perform (as required).
definitions.example: The engine just won't go anymore.

definitions.definition: To start; to begin (an action or process).
definitions.example: Get ready, get set, go!

definitions.definition: To take a turn, especially in a game.
definitions.example: It’s your turn; go.

definitions.definition: To attend.
definitions.example: I go to school at the schoolhouse.

definitions.definition: To proceed:
To follow or travel along (a path):
To extend (from one point in time or space to another).
definitions.example: This property goes all the way to the state line.

definitions.definition: To lead (to a place); to give access to.
definitions.example: Does this road go to Fort Smith?

definitions.definition: To become. (The adjective that follows usually describes a negative state.)
definitions.example: After failing as a criminal, he decided to go straight.

definitions.definition: To assume the obligation or function of; to be, to serve as.
To continuously or habitually be in a state.
definitions.example: I don't want my children to go hungry.

definitions.definition: To come to (a certain condition or state).
definitions.example: They went into debt, she goes to sleep around 10 o'clock.

definitions.definition: To change (from one value to another) in the meaning of wend.
definitions.example: The traffic light went straight from green to red.

definitions.definition: To turn out, to result; to come to (a certain result).
definitions.example: How did your meeting with Smith go?

definitions.definition: To tend (toward a result).
definitions.example: These experiences go to make us stronger.

definitions.definition: To contribute to a (specified) end product or result.
definitions.example: qualities that go to make a lady / lip-reader / sharpshooter

definitions.definition: To pass, to be used up:
To die.
To be discarded.
definitions.example: This chair has got to go.

definitions.definition: To be lost or out:
To break down or apart:
To be sold.
definitions.example: Everything must go.

definitions.definition: To be given, especially to be assigned or allotted.
definitions.example: The award went to Steven Spielberg.

definitions.definition: To survive or get by; to last or persist for a stated length of time.
definitions.example: Can you two go twenty minutes without arguing?!

definitions.definition: To have a certain record.
definitions.example: The team is going five in a row.

definitions.definition: To be authoritative, accepted, or valid:
To say (something), to make a sound:
To be expressed or composed (a certain way).
definitions.example: As the story goes, he got the idea for the song while sitting in traffic.

definitions.definition: To resort (to).
definitions.example: I'll go to court if I have to.

definitions.definition: To apply or subject oneself to:
To fit (in a place, or together with something):
To date.
definitions.example: He's been going with her for two weeks.

definitions.definition: To attack:
To be in general; to be usually.
definitions.example: As sentences go, this one is pretty boring.

definitions.definition: To take (a particular part or share); to participate in to the extent of.
definitions.example: Let's go halves on this.

definitions.definition: To yield or weigh.
definitions.example: Those babies go five tons apiece.

definitions.definition: To offer, bid or bet an amount; to pay.
definitions.example: I'll go a ten-spot.

definitions.definition: To enjoy. (Compare go for.)
definitions.example: I could go a beer right about now.

definitions.definition: To urinate or defecate.
definitions.example: Have you managed to go today, Mrs. Miggins?

definitions.definition: A departure.
definitions.example: Thy going is not lonely, with thee goes thy Husband

definitions.definition: The suitability of ground for riding, walking etc.
definitions.example: The going was very difficult over the ice.

definitions.definition: Progress.
definitions.example: We made good going for a while, but then we came to the price.

definitions.definition: Conditions for advancing in any way.
definitions.example: Not only were the streets not paved with gold, but the going was difficult for an immigrant.

definitions.definition: Pregnancy; gestation; childbearing
(in the plural) Course of life; behaviour; doings; ways.
(in the phrase "the going of") The whereabouts (of something).
definitions.example: I can't find my sunglasses; you haven't seen the going of them, have you?

definitions.definition: Likely to continue; viable.
definitions.example: He didn't want to make an unsecured loan to the business because it didn't look like a going concern.

definitions.definition: Current, prevailing.
definitions.example: The going rate for manual snow-shoveling is $25 an hour.

definitions.definition: (especially after a noun phrase with a superlative) Available.
definitions.example: He has the easiest job going.
